dict.string: This will configure the settings for the App Auto-Patch tool
Optional. A human-readable description of this payload. This description is shown on the Detail screen.
A human-readable name for the profile payload. This name is displayed on the Detail screen. It does not have to be unique.
A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited. Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier
A reverse-DNS-style identifier for the specific payload. It is usually the same identifier as the root-level PayloadIdentifier value with an additional component appended.
The type of the payload, a reverse dns string.
A globally unique identifier for the payload. The actual content is unimportant, but it must be globally unique. In macOS, you can use uuidgen to generate reasonable UUIDs.
The version of the whole configuration profile.
The version number of the individual payload.
This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user
The number of days after the patching cadence start date (Zero Date) that the patching complete status will reset from TRUE to FALSE
The day of the week to force the patching cadence start date (Zero Date) to go back to in order to have the patch cadence start the same day of the week for all users
The maximum number of automatic deferrals allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep
The maximum number of user selected deferrals allowed before App Auto-Patch will no longer allow deferrals and will automatically patch when the timer expires
The maximum number of days that automatic deferrals are allowed if the system is in user-enabled Focus/Do Not Disturb or when a process has requested that the display not go to sleep
The maximum number of days deferrals allowed before App Auto-Patch will no longer allow deferrals and will automatically patch when the timer expires
The number of minutes to defer until the next update workflow attempt if a user choses not install updates
The number of minutes to defer if AAP detects an error in the workflow
The number of minutes to defer the update restart dialog automatically if a process has prevented display sleep (for example, during an active meeting) or the user has Focus or Do Not Disturb enabled
Display a deferral time pop-up menu in the non-deadline install dialog that allows the user to override the Deferral Timer Default timer
Amount of time in minutes until AAP is relaunched after a workflow. This timer results in AAP acting as a permanent agent that checks for app updates on a regular basis
Forces the AAP dialogs to stay on top of all other windows
Time given to the user to respond to deferral prompt if enabled
What happens when the deferral timer expires
Deterines if the Dialog should automatically close after completion if there is no response from the end-user
The number of seconds the AAP dialog will automatically close if UnattendedExit is set to TRUE
Toggles swiftDialog to use an overlay icon
A space-separated list of Installomator labels to ignore for the AAP workflow. Supports wilddcards
a space-separated list of Installomator labels that are required, regardless if the app is installed or or the latest version. Supports wildcards.

A space-separated list of optional Installomator labels. Labels in this category are only included if the app exists on the end-users device and will force install even if its the latest version. Does Not Support Wildcards
Allows you to customize the name of App Auto-Patch to something else
This will convert any apps found in the users home folder to the /Applications folder
Ignore apps found in '/Users/'. If an update is found in '/Users/' and variable is set to false, the app will be updated into the application's default path
A space-separated list of options to override default Installomator options (i.e., BLOCKING_PROCESS_ACTION=prompt_user NOTIFY=silent LOGO=appstore)
This will prevent Installomator from automatically updating. If Installomator does not exist in the working folder, it will still download from GitHub to prevent script failure

Determines if the AAP script should use the Main, Release, or Custom version of Installomator. The version from the Main branch typically includes more recent updates from PR's to fix issues or add new labels. If using Custom, you must also set the InstallomatorVersionCustomRepoPath and InstallomatorVersionCustomBranchName keys

If InstallomatorVersion is set to Custom, enter the Github Site and Repository name in the following format: site_name/repo_name . For example, if the custom fork is located at https://github.com/TechTrekkie/Installomator, you would set this key to techtrekkie/installomator
The name of the branch you want to use in your custom repo, typically main.
Remove Installomator after App Auto-Patch is completed
For the Support Team details that display in the Help Message
For the Support Team details that display in the Help Message
For the Support Team details that display in the Help Message
For the Support Team details that display in the Help Message
Determines if Webhooks are sent when patching is completed
The Slack Webhook URL to use if WebhookFeature is set to TRUE
The Teams Webhook URL to use if WebhookFeature is set to TRUE
Disables the discovery of applications that require patching. If a list of labels from a previous discovery exists, AAP will use that list for the workflow
Disable the automatic relaunch of AAP after the current workflow successfully completes
Workflow Install Now Patching Status Action
Determines if the Patching Completion Status is set to true when using the --workflow-install-now trigger
All features related to how App Auto Patch defines the user interface.
The individual buttons and text elements that can be customized. This includes per country localization.
The targeted language locale for the user interface. Note: For a list of locales, please run the following command in Terminal: /usr/bin/locale -a
For a list of locales, please run the following command in Terminal: /usr/bin/locale -a
Language for the defer button in dialogs when the deferral time is sometime today.
Language for the defer button in dialogs when the deferral time is tomorrow
Language for the defer button in dialogs when the deferral time is in the future.
Language for deferral timer durations - Minutes
Language for deferral timer durations - Hour
Language for deferral timer durations - Hours
Language for deferral timer durations - and
Language for deferral timer durations - days
Language for deferral timer durations - times
Language for deferral timer durations - There are
Language for the message displayed during App Discovery
Language for the action message during App Discovery
Langauge for the progress message during App Discovery
Language for Button1 of the Deferral Dialog
Language for Button1 of the Deferral Dialog
Langauge for part 1 of the infobox on the Deferral Dialog
Langauge for part 2 of the infobox on the Deferral Dialog
Langauge for part 3 of the infobox on the Deferral Dialog
Langauge for part 1 of the message on the Deferral Dialog
You can **Defer** the updates or **Continue** to close the applications and apply updates.
Language for part 2 of the message on the Deferral Dialog
No deadline date and unlimited deferrals
Updates will automatically install after the timer expires. \n\n #### No Deferrals Remaining ####
application(s) that require updates\n\n You have deferred the maximum number of
All Apps Up To Date Button 1
All Apps Up To Date Button 1
All Apps Up To Date Message
All Apps Up To Date Message
All apps are up to date.
If you need assistance, please contact
